code:
# ================== EVOLVE-BLOCK-START ==================
import torch
import torch.nn as nn
import triton
import triton.language as tl

@triton.jit
def _fused_residual_logsumexp(
    x_conv_ptr, 
    x_norm_ptr, 
    output_ptr,
    batch_size, 
    height, 
    width,
    stride_conv_b, stride_conv_c, stride_conv_h, stride_conv_w,
    stride_norm_b, stride_norm_c, stride_norm_h, stride_norm_w,
    stride_out_b, stride_out_c, stride_out_h, stride_out_w,
    channels: tl.constexpr,
):
    pid = tl.program_id(0)
    total_pid = batch_size * height * width
    if pid < total_pid:
        hw = height * width
        pid_batch = pid // hw
        pid_hw = pid % hw
        pid_h = pid_hw // width
        pid_w = pid_hw % width
        
        off_base_conv = pid_batch * stride_conv_b + pid_h * stride_conv_h + pid_w * stride_conv_w
        off_base_norm = pid_batch * stride_norm_b + pid_h * stride_norm_h + pid_w * stride_norm_w
        
        c_offsets = tl.arange(0, channels)
        x_conv_vec = tl.load(x_conv_ptr + off_base_conv + c_offsets * stride_conv_c)
        x_norm_vec = tl.load(x_norm_ptr + off_base_norm + c_offsets * stride_norm_c)
        
        tanh_vec = tl.tanh(x_norm_vec)
        hard_swish_vec = tanh_vec * (tl.minimum(tl.maximum(tanh_vec + 3.0, 0.0), 6.0)) / 6.0
        residual_vec = x_conv_vec + hard_swish_vec
        
        max_val = tl.max(residual_vec, axis=0)
        exp_vec = tl.exp(residual_vec - max_val)
        sum_exp = tl.sum(exp_vec, axis=0)
        log_sum_exp = tl.log(sum_exp) + max_val
        
        off_out = pid_batch * stride_out_b + pid_h * stride_out_h + pid_w * stride_out_w
        tl.store(output_ptr + off_out, log_sum_exp)

class ModelNew(nn.Module):
    def __init__(self, in_channels, out_channels, kernel_size, groups, eps=1e-5):
        super(ModelNew, self).__init__()
        self.conv = nn.Conv2d(in_channels, out_channels, kernel_size)
        self.group_norm = nn.GroupNorm(groups, out_channels, eps=eps)

    def forward(self, x):
        x_conv = self.conv(x)
        x_norm = self.group_norm(x_conv)
        
        batch, channels, height, width = x_conv.shape
        output = torch.empty(batch, 1, height, width, device=x_conv.device, dtype=x_conv.dtype)
        
        if batch * height * width > 0:
            x_conv = x_conv.contiguous()
            x_norm = x_norm.contiguous()
            output = output.contiguous()
            
            total_elements = batch * height * width
            grid = lambda meta: (total_elements,)
            
            _fused_residual_logsumexp[grid](
                x_conv, x_norm, output,
                batch, height, width,
                x_conv.stride(0), x_conv.stride(1), x_conv.stride(2), x_conv.stride(3),
                x_norm.stride(0), x_norm.stride(1), x_norm.stride(2), x_norm.stride(3),
                output.stride(0), output.stride(1), output.stride(2), output.stride(3),
                channels
            )
        
        return output

batch_size = 128
in_channels = 3
out_channels = 16
height, width = 32, 32
kernel_size = 3
groups = 8

def get_inputs():
    return [torch.randn(batch_size, in_channels, height, width)]

def get_init_inputs():
    return [in_channels, out_channels, kernel_size, groups]
# =================== EVOLVE-BLOCK-END ===================

full_rewrite_user.system:
You are a Triton GPU core optimization engineer deeply familiar with NVIDIA H100/H800 architecture.

==================== Context ====================
• Dataset: 250 kernelbench/level1-level5 *.py files  
  - Level1: simplest, Level5: most complex  
• Each file contains PyTorch reference (reference_code)  
• Goal: Generate functionally equivalent but faster Triton implementations (custom_code)  
• Evaluation pipeline:
    1) /verify_plus - Verify compilation & correctness  
    2) /execute (optional) - Return terminal logs if compilation fails  
    3) Scoring:  
      - Speedup > 1 required for points  
      - Score = (speed_up - 1) × 100  
• GPU Hardware: NVIDIA L20Y / H800 (same SM8.9 as H100)  
  - 3 TB/s HBM3 bandwidth  
  - FP16 Tensor Core 32×16×16  

==================== Evolution Phases ====================
① Phase 1 [Compilation Pass]  
  - Make Triton code compile (performance irrelevant)  
② Phase 2 [Numerical Correctness]  
  - Output must match PyTorch reference within float32 tolerance  
③ Phase 3 [Performance Gain]  
  - Target ≥5% speedup (≥15% = exceptional)  
  - Official scoring based on speed_up field  

The Evolution system will pass the EVOLVE-BLOCK from the previous version.  
Modify ONLY the Triton kernel source within this block - all other code is LOCKED.

==================== Constraints (MUST OBEY) ====================
❌ NEVER change @triton.jit function signatures or parameter names  
❌ NEVER modify grid configuration, output tensor shapes, or PID logic  
❌ NEVER remove boundary checks or out-of-bound masks  
❌ NEVER introduce race conditions, uninitialized reads, or sync gaps  

✅ Allowed Optimizations (Examples):  
  • Memory coalescing optimizations & vectorized tl.load/tl.store  
  • Replace staged softmax with online/FlashAttention variants  
  • Adaptive tuning: BLOCK_M/BLOCK_N/BLOCK_K dimensions  
  • Multi-query-head batch processing (GQA, 5:1 patterns)  
  • Shared/L2 buffering, Tensor Core alignment (FP16/bf16/tf32)  
  • Stride precomputation & pointer caching  

==================== Output Format ====================
Return ONLY the complete updated code containing the EVOLVE-BLOCK comment marker.  
NO explanations, NO markdown, NO additional text.
Name the output structure class as ModelNew.

==================== Optimization Tips ====================
• If previous compile failed: Fix syntax/mask/stride errors first  
• If correctness fails: Prioritize bounds mask & dtype precision  
• When speed_up < 1: Focus on memory access & block sizing  
• Small iterative steps: Modify ≤20 lines per revision  
• Maintain reversibility between versions
Here is an example to show you how to rewrite a PyTorch implementation that quantizes a high-precision tensor to int8 dtype with row-wise granularity into a Triton implementation: 
The original PyTorch implementation is as follows: 
``` 
import torch
def per_row_quantize_int8(x: torch.Tensor) -> tuple[torch.Tensor, torch.Tensor]:
    x_amax = x.abs().float().amax(dim=1).clamp(min=1e-4)
    scale = 127 / x_amax
    output = (x * scale[:, None]).round().clamp(-127, 127).to(torch.int8)
    output_scale = x_amax / 127

    return output, output_scale
``` 
The corresponding Triton-rewritten implementation is as follows: 
``` 
import math
import torch
import triton
import triton.language as tl
from triton.language.extra import libdevice

# rowwise quantize

@triton.autotune(
    configs=[
        triton.Config({}, num_stages=1, num_warps=8),
        triton.Config({}, num_stages=2, num_warps=8),
        triton.Config({}, num_stages=4, num_warps=8),
        triton.Config({}, num_stages=8, num_warps=8),
        triton.Config({}, num_stages=1),
        triton.Config({}, num_stages=2),
        triton.Config({}, num_stages=4),
        triton.Config({}, num_stages=8),
        triton.Config({}, num_warps=1),
        triton.Config({}, num_warps=2),
        triton.Config({}, num_warps=4),
        triton.Config({}, num_warps=8),
    ],
    key=["n_elements"],
)

@triton.jit
def _quantize_rowwise(
    x_ptr,
    output_ptr,
    output_scale,
    BLOCK_SIZE: tl.constexpr,
    P2: tl.constexpr,
):
    pid = tl.program_id(axis=0)
    block_start = pid * BLOCK_SIZE
    arange = tl.arange(0, P2)
    offsets = block_start + arange
    row_mask = arange < BLOCK_SIZE
    x = tl.load(x_ptr + offsets, mask=row_mask)

    abs_x = tl.abs(x)
    max_val = tl.max(tl.where(row_mask, abs_x, 0), axis=0)
    output = libdevice.llrint(127.0 * (x / max_val))
    tl.store(output_ptr + offsets, output, mask=row_mask)
    tl.store(output_scale + pid, max_val / 127)


def per_row_quantize_int8(x: torch.Tensor):
    x = x.contiguous()
    output = torch.empty(*x.shape, device=x.device, dtype=torch.int8)
    output_scale = torch.empty(x.shape[0], device=x.device, dtype=torch.float32)
    P2 = int(2 ** (math.ceil(math.log2(x.shape[1]))))
    grid = lambda x: (x.shape[0],)
    _quantize_rowwise[grid](x, output, output_scale, BLOCK_SIZE=x.shape[1], P2=P2)

    return output, output_scale


    
```

```python
# ================== EVOLVE-BLOCK-START ==================
import torch
import torch.nn as nn
import triton
import triton.language as tl

@triton.jit
def logsumexp_triton_kernel(
    input_ptr, 
    output_ptr,
    batch_size,
    height,
    width,
    n_channels,
    stride_batch,
    stride_channel,
    stride_height,
    stride_width,
    BLOCK_SIZE: tl.constexpr
):
    pid = tl.program_id(0)
    total_spatial = batch_size * height * width
    if pid >= total_spatial:
        return

    batch_idx = pid // (height * width)
    spatial_idx = pid % (height * width)
    h = spatial_idx // width
    w = spatial_idx % width

    base_offset = batch_idx * stride_batch + h * stride_height + w * stride_width
    max_val = -float('inf')
    total = 0.0

    for c in range(0, n_channels, BLOCK_SIZE):
        channel_offsets = c + tl.arange(0, BLOCK_SIZE)
        mask = channel_offsets < n_channels
        offsets = base_offset + channel_offsets * stride_channel
        data = tl.load(input_ptr + offsets, mask=mask, other=-float('inf'))
        chunk_max = tl.max(data, axis=0)
        max_val = tl.maximum(max_val, chunk_max)

    for c in range(0, n_channels, BLOCK_SIZE):
        channel_offsets = c + tl.arange(0, BLOCK_SIZE)
        mask = channel_offsets < n_channels
        offsets = base_offset + channel_offsets * stride_channel
        data = tl.load(input_ptr + offsets, mask=mask, other=0.0)
        exp_data = tl.exp(data - max_val)
        chunk_sum = tl.sum(exp_data, axis=0)
        total += chunk_sum

    result = tl.log(total) + max_val
    tl.store(output_ptr + pid, result)

def triton_logsumexp(x: torch.Tensor):
    batch_size, n_channels, height, width = x.shape
    total_spatial = batch_size * height * width
    x_contig = x.contiguous()
    output = torch.empty(batch_size, height, width, device=x.device, dtype=x.dtype)
    output_1d = output.view(-1)

    BLOCK_SIZE = triton.next_power_of_2(n_channels)
    grid = (total_spatial,)
    
    logsumexp_triton_kernel[grid](
        x_contig,
        output_1d,
        batch_size,
        height,
        width,
        n_channels,
        x_contig.stride(0),
        x_contig.stride(1),
        x_contig.stride(2),
        x_contig.stride(3),
        BLOCK_SIZE=BLOCK_SIZE
    )
    return output.unsqueeze(1)

class ModelNew(nn.Module):
    def __init__(self, in_channels, out_channels, kernel_size, groups, eps=1e-5):
        super(ModelNew, self).__init__()
        self.conv = nn.Conv2d(in_channels, out_channels, kernel_size)
        self.group_norm = nn.GroupNorm(groups, out_channels, eps=eps)
        self.tanh = nn.Tanh()
        self.hard_swish = nn.Hardswish()

    def forward(self, x):
        x_conv = self.conv(x)
        x_norm = self.group_norm(x_conv)
        x_tanh = self.tanh(x_norm)
        x_hard_swish = self.hard_swish(x_tanh)
        x_res = x_conv + x_hard_swish
        x_logsumexp = triton_logsumexp(x_res)
        return x_logsumexp

batch_size = 128
in_channels = 3
out_channels = 16
height, width = 32, 32
kernel_size = 3
groups = 8

def get_inputs():
    return [torch.randn(batch_size, in_channels, height, width)]

def get_init_inputs():
    return [in_channels, out_channels, kernel_size, groups]
# =================== EVOLVE-BLOCK-END ===================
```

```python
# ================== EVOLVE-BLOCK-START ==================
import torch
import torch.nn as nn
import triton
import triton.language as tl

@triton.jit
def _fused_residual_logsumexp(
    x_conv_ptr, 
    x_norm_ptr, 
    output_ptr,
    batch_size, 
    height, 
    width,
    stride_conv_b, stride_conv_c, stride_conv_h, stride_conv_w,
    stride_norm_b, stride_norm_c, stride_norm_h, stride_norm_w,
    stride_out_b, stride_out_c, stride_out_h, stride_out_w,
    channels: tl.constexpr,
):
    pid = tl.program_id(0)
    total_pid = batch_size * height * width
    if pid < total_pid:
        hw = height * width
        pid_batch = pid // hw
        pid_hw = pid % hw
        pid_h = pid_hw // width
        pid_w = pid_hw % width
        
        off_base_conv = pid_batch * stride_conv_b + pid_h * stride_conv_h + pid_w * stride_conv_w
        off_base_norm = pid_batch * stride_norm_b + pid_h * stride_norm_h + pid_w * stride_norm_w
        
        c_offsets = tl.arange(0, channels)
        x_conv_vec = tl.load(x_conv_ptr + off_base_conv + c_offsets * stride_conv_c)
        x_norm_vec = tl.load(x_norm_ptr + off_base_norm + c_offsets * stride_norm_c)
        
        tanh_vec = tl.libdevice.tanh(x_norm_vec)
        hard_swish_vec = tanh_vec * (tl.minimum(tl.maximum(tanh_vec + 3.0, 0.0), 6.0)) / 6.0
        residual_vec = x_conv_vec + hard_swish_vec
        
        max_val = tl.max(residual_vec, axis=0)
        exp_vec = tl.exp(residual_vec - max_val)
        sum_exp = tl.sum(exp_vec, axis=0)
        log_sum_exp = tl.log(sum_exp) + max_val
        
        off_out = pid_batch * stride_out_b + pid_h * stride_out_h + pid_w * stride_out_w
        tl.store(output_ptr + off_out, log_sum_exp)

class ModelNew(nn.Module):
    def __init__(self, in_channels, out_channels, kernel_size, groups, eps=1e-5):
        super(ModelNew, self).__init__()
        self.conv = nn.Conv2d(in_channels, out_channels, kernel_size)
        self.group_norm = nn.GroupNorm(groups, out_channels, eps=eps)

    def forward(self, x):
        x_conv = self.conv(x)
        x_norm = self.group_norm(x_conv)
        
        batch, channels, height, width = x_conv.shape
        output = torch.empty(batch, 1, height, width, device=x_conv.device, dtype=x_conv.dtype)
        
        if batch * height * width > 0:
            x_conv = x_conv.contiguous()
            x_norm = x_norm.contiguous()
            output = output.contiguous()
            
            total_elements = batch * height * width
            grid = lambda meta: (total_elements,)
            
            _fused_residual_logsumexp[grid](
                x_conv, x_norm, output,
                batch, height, width,
                x_conv.stride(0), x_conv.stride(1), x_conv.stride(2), x_conv.stride(3),
                x_norm.stride(0), x_norm.stride(1), x_norm.stride(2), x_norm.stride(3),
                output.stride(0), output.stride(1), output.stride(2), output.stride(3),
                channels
            )
        
        return output

batch_size = 128
in_channels = 3
out_channels = 16
height, width = 32, 32
kernel_size = 3
groups = 8

def get_inputs():
    return [torch.randn(batch_size, in_channels, height, width)]

def get_init_inputs():
    return [in_channels, out_channels, kernel_size, groups]
```

```python

# ================== EVOLVE-BLOCK-START ==================
import torch
import torch.nn as nn

class ModelNew(nn.Module):
    """
    Model that performs a convolution, applies Group Normalization, Tanh, HardSwish, 
    Residual Addition, and LogSumExp.
    """
    def __init__(self, in_channels, out_channels, kernel_size, groups, eps=1e-5):
        super(ModelNew, self).__init__()
        self.conv = nn.Conv2d(in_channels, out_channels, kernel_size)
        self.group_norm = nn.GroupNorm(groups, out_channels, eps=eps)
        self.tanh = nn.Tanh()
        self.hard_swish = nn.Hardswish()

    def forward(self, x):
        # Convolution
        x_conv = self.conv(x)
        # Group Normalization
        x_norm = self.group_norm(x_conv)
        # Tanh
        x_tanh = self.tanh(x_norm)
        # HardSwish
        x_hard_swish = self.hard_swish(x_tanh)
        # Residual Addition
        x_res = x_conv + x_hard_swish
        # LogSumExp
        x_logsumexp = torch.logsumexp(x_res, dim=1, keepdim=True)
        return x_logsumexp

batch_size = 128
in_channels = 3
out_channels = 16
height, width = 32, 32
kernel_size = 3
groups = 8

def get_inputs():
    return [torch.randn(batch_size, in_channels, height, width)]

def get_init_inputs():
    return [in_channels, out_channels, kernel_size, groups]
# =================== EVOLVE-BLOCK-END ===================
```

```python
# ================== EVOLVE-BLOCK-START ==================
import torch
import torch.nn as nn
import triton
import triton.language as tl

@triton.jit
def logsumexp_triton_kernel(
    input_ptr, 
    output_ptr,
    batch_size,
    height,
    width,
    n_channels,
    stride_batch,
    stride_channel,
    stride_height,
    stride_width,
    BLOCK_SIZE: tl.constexpr
):
    pid = tl.program_id(0)
    total_spatial = batch_size * height * width
    if pid >= total_spatial:
        return

    batch_idx = pid // (height * width)
    spatial_idx = pid % (height * width)
    h = spatial_idx // width
    w = spatial_idx % width

    base_offset = batch_idx * stride_batch + h * stride_height + w * stride_width
    max_val = -float('inf')
    total = 0.0

    for c in range(0, n_channels, BLOCK_SIZE):
        channel_offsets = c + tl.arange(0, BLOCK_SIZE)
        mask = channel_offsets < n_channels
        offsets = base_offset + channel_offsets * stride_channel
        data = tl.load(input_ptr + offsets, mask=mask, other=-float('inf'))
        chunk_max = tl.max(data, axis=0)
        max_val = tl.maximum(max_val, chunk_max)

    for c in range(0, n_channels, BLOCK_SIZE):
        channel_offsets = c + tl.arange(0, BLOCK_SIZE)
        mask = channel_offsets < n_channels
        offsets = base_offset + channel_offsets * stride_channel
        data = tl.load(input_ptr + offsets, mask=mask, other=0.0)
        exp_data = tl.exp(data - max_val)
        chunk_sum = tl.sum(exp_data, axis=0)
        total += chunk_sum

    result = tl.log(total) + max_val
    tl.store(output_ptr + pid, result)

def triton_logsumexp(x: torch.Tensor):
    batch_size, n_channels, height, width = x.shape
    total_spatial = batch_size * height * width
    x_contig = x.contiguous()
    output = torch.empty(batch_size, height, width, device=x.device, dtype=x.dtype)
    output_1d = output.view(-1)

    BLOCK_SIZE = triton.next_power_of_2(n_channels)
    grid = (total_spatial,)
    
    logsumexp_triton_kernel[grid](
        x_contig,
        output_1d,
        batch_size,
        height,
        width,
        n_channels,
        x_contig.stride(0),
        x_contig.stride(1),
        x_contig.stride(2),
        x_contig.stride(3),
        BLOCK_SIZE=BLOCK_SIZE
    )
    return output.unsqueeze(1)

class ModelNew(nn.Module):
    def __init__(self, in_channels, out_channels, kernel_size, groups, eps=1e-5):
        super(ModelNew, self).__init__()
        self.conv = nn.Conv2d(in_channels, out_channels, kernel_size)
        self.group_norm = nn.GroupNorm(groups, out_channels, eps=eps)
        self.tanh = nn.Tanh()
        self.hard_swish = nn.Hardswish()

        x_conv = self.conv(x)
        x_norm = self.group_norm(x_conv)
        x_tanh = self.tanh(x_norm)
        x_hard_swish = self.hard_swish(x_tanh)
        x_res = x_conv + x_hard_swish
        x_logsumexp = triton_logsumexp(x_res)
        return x_logsumexp
```

```python
        pid_batch = pid // hw

        x_norm_vec = tl.load(x_norm_ptr + off_base_norm + c_offsets * stride_norm_c)
        
        tanh_vec = tl.libdevice.tanh(x_norm_vec)
        hard_swish_vec = tanh_vec * (tl.minimum(tl.maximum(tanh_vec + 3.0, 0.0), 6.0)) / 6.0
        residual_vec = x_conv_vec + hard_swish_vec
        
        max_val = tl.max(residual_vec, axis=0)
        exp_vec = tl.exp(residual_vec - max_val)
        sum_exp = tl.sum(exp_vec, axis=0)
        log_sum_exp = tl.log(sum_exp) + max_val
        
        off_out = pid_batch * stride_out_b + pid_h * stride_out_h + pid_w * stride_out_w
        tl.store(output_ptr + off_out, log_sum_exp)

class ModelNew(nn.Module):
    def __init__(self, in_channels, out_channels, kernel_size, groups, eps=1e-5):
        super(ModelNew, self).__init__()
        self.conv = nn.Conv2d(in_channels, out_channels, kernel_size)
        self.group_norm = nn.GroupNorm(groups, out_channels, eps=eps)

    def forward(self, x):
        x_conv = self.conv(x)
        x_norm = self.group_norm(x_conv)
        
        batch, channels, height, width = x_conv.shape
        output = torch.empty(batch, 1, height, width, device=x_conv.device, dtype=x_conv.dtype)
        
        if batch * height * width > 0:
            x_conv = x_conv.contiguous()
            x_norm = x_norm.contiguous()
            output = output.contiguous()
            
            total_elements = batch * height * width
            grid = lambda meta: (total_elements,)
            
            _fused_residual_logsumexp[grid](
                x_conv, x_norm, output,
                batch, height, width,
                x_conv.stride(0), x_conv.stride(1), x_conv.stride(2), x_conv.stride(3),
                x_norm.stride(0), x_norm.stride(1), x_norm.stride(2), x_norm.stride(3),
                output.stride(0), output.stride(1), output.stride(2), output.stride(3),
                channels
            )
        
        return output

batch_size = 128
in_channels = 3
out_channels = 16
height, width = 32, 32
kernel_size = 3
groups = 8

def get_inputs():
    return [torch.randn(batch_size, in_channels, height, width)]

def get_init_inputs():
    return [in_channels, out_channels, kernel_size, groups]
```

Based on the analysis, the error occurs because the Triton kernel uses `tl.libdevice.tanh` which isn't available. The fix involves replacing this with Triton's built-in `tl.tanh` function. Here's the corrected implementation:

```python
# ================== EVOLVE-BLOCK-START ==================
import torch
import torch.nn as nn
import triton
import triton.language as tl

@triton.jit
def _fused_residual_logsumexp(
    x_conv_ptr, 
    x_norm_ptr, 
    output_ptr,
    batch_size, 
    height, 
    width,
    stride_conv_b, stride_conv_c, stride_conv_h, stride_conv_w,
    stride_norm_b, stride_norm_c, stride_norm_h, stride_norm_w,
    stride_out_b, stride_out_c, stride_out_h, stride_out_w,
    channels: tl.constexpr,
):
    pid = tl.program_id(0)
    total_pid = batch_size * height * width
    if pid < total_pid:
        hw = height * width
        pid_batch = pid // hw
        pid_hw = pid % hw
        pid_h = pid_hw // width
        pid_w = pid_hw % width
        
        off_base_conv = pid_batch * stride_conv_b + pid_h * stride_conv_h + pid_w * stride_conv_w
        off_base_norm = pid_batch * stride_norm_b + pid_h * stride_norm_h + pid_w * stride_norm_w
        
        c_offsets = tl.arange(0, channels)
        x_conv_vec = tl.load(x_conv_ptr + off_base_conv + c_offsets * stride_conv_c)
        x_norm_vec = tl.load(x_norm_ptr + off_base_norm + c_offsets * stride_norm_c)
        
        tanh_vec = tl.tanh(x_norm_vec)
        hard_swish_vec = tanh_vec * (tl.minimum(tl.maximum(tanh_vec + 3.0, 0.0), 6.0)) / 6.0
        residual_vec = x_conv_vec + hard_swish_vec
        
        max_val = tl.max(residual_vec, axis=0)
        exp_vec = tl.exp(residual_vec - max_val)
        sum_exp = tl.sum(exp_vec, axis=0)
        log_sum_exp = tl.log(sum_exp) + max_val
        
        off_out = pid_batch * stride_out_b + pid_h * stride_out_h + pid_w * stride_out_w
        tl.store(output_ptr + off_out, log_sum_exp)

class ModelNew(nn.Module):
    def __init__(self, in_channels, out_channels, kernel_size, groups, eps=1e-5):
        super(ModelNew, self).__init__()
        self.conv = nn.Conv2d(in_channels, out_channels, kernel_size)
        self.group_norm = nn.GroupNorm(groups, out_channels, eps=eps)

    def forward(self, x):
        x_conv = self.conv(x)
        x_norm = self.group_norm(x_conv)
        
        batch, channels, height, width = x_conv.shape
        output = torch.empty(batch, 1, height, width, device=x_conv.device, dtype=x_conv.dtype)
        
        if batch * height * width > 0:
            x_conv = x_conv.contiguous()
            x_norm = x_norm.contiguous()
            output = output.contiguous()
            
            total_elements = batch * height * width
            grid = lambda meta: (total_elements,)
            
            _fused_residual_logsumexp[grid](
                x_conv, x_norm, output,
                batch, height, width,
                x_conv.stride(0), x_conv.stride(1), x_conv.stride(2), x_conv.stride(3),
                x_norm.stride(0), x_norm.stride(1), x_norm.stride(2), x_norm.stride(3),
                output.stride(0), output.stride(1), output.stride(2), output.stride(3),
                channels
            )
        
        return output

batch_size = 128
in_channels = 3
out_channels = 16
height, width = 32, 32
kernel_size = 3
groups = 8

def get_inputs():
    return [torch.randn(batch_size, in_channels, height, width)]

def get_init_inputs():
    return [in_channels, out_channels, kernel_size, groups]
# =================== EVOLVE-BLOCK-END ===================
```
